SENT.plain: PURPOSE: We report a case of woman with Marfan syndrome and longstanding postlensectomy scleral wound dehiscence

METHODS: A 34-year-old woman with Marfan syndrome who underwent lensectomy 20 years ago had conjunctival leakage with chronic hypotony and conjunctival cystic degeneration secondary to scleral wound dehiscence
Presentation, clinical evaluation, and particular treatment with autologous cultivated conjunctival epithelium transplantation and scleral patch graft are described
RESULTS: A 6-month follow-up confirmed complete epithelization of the ocular surface and absence of leaking from the wound with normal intraocular pressure
CONCLUSIONS: Transplantation of autologous cultivated conjunctival epithelium appears to be a valid strategy in the treatment of ocular disease requiring extensive excision of the conjunctiva
